title: Punjab’s Green Energy Push Hits Rural Roadblocks
summary: Punjab’s plan to convert 14.8 lakh t of paddy straw into biomass and CBG faces resistance over land rights, pollution fears, and lack of local benefits.

title: Punjab Promotes CBG Plants to Tackle Stubble Burning
summary: Punjab is rolling out 60 CBG projects and 11 biomass plants to manage crop residue and reduce air pollution—but faces local resistance despite public sector backing.

title: Guidelines Revised to Simplify Biomass Programme
summary: MNRE eased approval processes under its National Bioenergy Programme to benefit MSMEs and stubble-affected regions, driving faster biomass adoption.

title: India’s Biomass Supply Falls Short of Mandate
summary: The 5% biomass co-firing policy demands 100,000 t/day, but supply is just 5–7k t, raising alarm over stubble burning and energy dependence.

title: 71 Thermal Power Plants Now Co-Fire Biomass
summary: Co-firing expanded to 71 coal-fired plants, cutting carbon by 0.97 million t using 814,000 t of agro-residue. Constraints remain, especially in Delhi-NCR.

title: LITU Emerges as Hub for Green Pyro Innovations
summary: Laxminarayan Innovation Technological University will host a CoE on eco-friendly pyrotechnics—featuring biomass pellets and smokeless innovations.

title: MNRE Boosts Clean Energy with ₹857 Crore for Agro Waste
summary: MNRE will invest ₹857 crore to scale waste-to-energy operations including biomass and biogas, enhancing rural energy generation.

title: Green Pellets India Highlights Sustainable Fuel at Expo
summary: Green Pellets India is showcasing mustard, sawdust and agro-waste fuel solutions at the Bioenergy Global Expo 2025 in Delhi.

title: Top Indian States Offering High Subsidies for Pellet Plants
summary: Punjab, Haryana, Maharashtra, and MP offer capital subsidies up to 35–40% for biomass pellet plant setups, with quick ROI in 1.5–2.5 years.

title: India Leads World in Biomass Pellet Imports & Buyers
summary: India imported 450 pellet shipments in 2023–24 (650% YoY spike); top buyers include NTPC, Tata Power, Ambuja Cements, and Raymond.

title: Pharma Giant Replaces Coal with Biomass Boiler
summary: Piramal Pharma Ltd switches from coal to biomass boilers—cutting emissions and serving as an example for industrial clean energy transition.

title: Policy Tweaks Ease Biomass Pellet Subsidy Access
summary: MNRE revised biomass subsidy rules—dropping rigid contracts and easing inspection periods, making pellet plant approval faster and outcomes-based.

title: India’s Fashion Industry Eyes Biomass Boilers to Cut Emissions
summary: Textile firms like Arvind and Shahi are switching to biomass boilers, aiming to slash carbon emissions while coping with coal regulations.

title: Co-Firing Faces Technical Challenges Across Power Plants
summary: Power plants struggle with technical barriers, supply gaps, and equipment readiness—hindering India’s 5% biomass co-firing mandate rollout.

title: MNRE Flexes Additional Subsidy, IoT for Pellet Plants
summary: New MNRE rules cut red tape for biomass plant approval, offer performance-linked subsidy, and allow IoT-based monitoring over costly SCADA systems.

title: Global Pellet Market Forecast to Grow Strongly to 2033
summary: The global wood pellet market is expected to surge from USD 14B in 2024 to USD 22.6B by 2033, with 5.5% CAGR growth predicted.

title: Regulations Clarify Biomass Co-firing in Thermal Plants
summary: New guidelines clarify co-firing protocols, pellet price benchmarks for NCR & regulatory support under SAMARTH Mission to scale biomass use.

title: India’s Agro Waste Monetized via Biomass & Biogas Investments
summary: Government boosts agri waste-based energy with ₹857 crores for biogas, biomass programs to support clean energy and rural development.

title: From Haze to Hope: Biomass as India's Energy Transition Path
summary: India’s surplus 140M t biomass is a key to clean energy—if scaled into pellets, stubble burning could reduce and rural incomes boost.
